body: onnxruntime depends on onnx. How would you handle onnx? The same question to ONNX. it's possible to create a single static library for ONNX? How will you install it and locate it?  Please tell us more about your plan.

I'm not too familiar with onnx, so I'm not sure if this is what you're looking for, but I've built onnxruntime for cpp, and am trying to use that. Could you clarify a bit further what you mean please?

Onnx runtime depends on some other libraries like onnx/protobuf/... . If we provided onnx runtime as a static library, you will still need these extra libraries to use. Here we have two choices:

1. onnxruntime distribute these third party libraries together within the same package. A drawback is we will force you using the versions we provide. You can't use a different version of onnx or protobuf. Generally speaking, I don't see people do this.  If your system has already installed protobuf, and we tried to provide a different on and override it ,...  It sounds dangerous.

2. onnxruntime  asks you get the third party libraries from somewhere and install it into your system. For example, you can get protobuf from  'apt-get' .  ONNX users can install onnx by:
```bash
apt-get install python3-pip python3-dev libprotobuf-dev protobuf-compiler
export CMAKE_ARGS="-DONNX_USE_PROTOBUF_SHARED_LIBS=ON"
pip install ...
```

But, when the problem comes to onnxruntime, we can't get ONNX from apt-get install. And there is no formal way to **install** ONNX as a C/C++ library. Second, onnxruntime depends on a beta version of eigen. You can't get it from any package manager. Though you still can install it manually. 

Theoretically it is possible to provide onnxruntime as a static library, but it's hard to use it correctly.

I care for the static library usage (we want to distribute our SDK as single dyn. library with everything compiled-in), but as long as ORT properly exports targets and their link interdependencies, I don't want/need single static library.


However, I am having problem with ORT compiled as static library in debug configuration with MSVC, where if I then link it into a binary compiled in debug configuration (also with MSVC), heap corruption occurs. Does the ORT build script change default debug compilation flags of the library?
We have a debug allocator. You will either use it in all places or disable it. Basically, it is another heap.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale due to inactivity and will be closed in 7 days if no further activity occurs. If further support is needed, please provide an update and/or more details.

If anyone interested in linking onnxruntime statically on Windows, here are the steps I followed:
- Download onnxruntime (e.g. in C:\Software)
```
 git clone --recursive https://github.com/Microsoft/onnxruntime
 cd onnxruntime
```
- Build onnxruntime w/o the shared library option (as suggested in #1472.
`.\build.bat --config Release --parallel`

This will create all required `.lib` files into the build/config folder you specified. Note that there is no `onnxruntime.lib`. In your application, you just need to link multiple libraries that onnxrunime uses.

- I used CMake to create a test application. In CMakeLists.txt file, add the following:
```
target_include_directories(
    ${PROJECT_NAME} PRIVATE 
    C:/Software/onnxruntime/include/onnxruntime
)

target_link_directories(
    ${PROJECT_NAME} PRIVATE
    C:/Software/onnxruntime/build/Windows/Release
)

target_link_libraries(
    ${PROJECT_NAME}
    Release/onnxruntime_session
    Release/onnxruntime_optimizer
    Release/onnxruntime_providers
    Release/onnxruntime_util
    Release/onnxruntime_framework
    Release/onnxruntime_graph
    Release/onnxruntime_mlas
    Release/onnxruntime_common
    Release/onnxruntime_flatbuffers
    Release/onnx_test_data_proto
    external/onnx/Release/onnx
    external/onnx/Release/onnx_proto
    external/protobuf/cmake/Release/libprotobuf-lite
    external/re2/Release/re2
    external/abseil-cpp/absl/base/Release/absl_base
    external/abseil-cpp/absl/base/Release/absl_throw_delegate
    external/abseil-cpp/absl/container/Release/absl_raw_hash_set
    external/abseil-cpp/absl/hash/Release/absl_hash
    external/abseil-cpp/absl/hash/Release/absl_city
    external/abseil-cpp/absl/hash/Release/absl_low_level_hash
)
```
- Finally, include the .h file in your main.cpp:
`#include "core/session/onnxruntime_cxx_api.h"`

Same idea on Linux except that could be needed:
```
--cmake_extra_defines CMAKE_POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE=ON
```

try build with `--enable_msvc_static_runtime`  https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/1472

thank you!

If anyone interested in linking onnxruntime statically on Windows, here are the steps I followed:

Download onnxruntime (e.g. in C:\Software)
 git clone --recursive https://github.com/Microsoft/onnxruntime

 cd onnxruntime


Build onnxruntime w/o the shared library option (as suggested in How to build and use onnxruntime static lib on windows?  #1472.
.\build.bat --config Release --parallel

This will create all required .lib files into the build/config folder you specified. Note that there is no onnxruntime.lib. In your application, you just need to link multiple libraries that onnxrunime uses.

I used CMake to create a test application. In CMakeLists.txt file, add the following:
target_include_directories(

    ${PROJECT_NAME} PRIVATE 

    C:/Software/onnxruntime/include/onnxruntime

)



target_link_directories(

    ${PROJECT_NAME} PRIVATE

    C:/Software/onnxruntime/build/Windows/Release

)



target_link_libraries(

    ${PROJECT_NAME}

    Release/onnxruntime_session

    Release/onnxruntime_optimizer

    Release/onnxruntime_providers

    Release/onnxruntime_util

    Release/onnxruntime_framework

    Release/onnxruntime_graph

    Release/onnxruntime_mlas

    Release/onnxruntime_common

    Release/onnxruntime_flatbuffers

    Release/onnx_test_data_proto

    external/onnx/Release/onnx

    external/onnx/Release/onnx_proto

    external/protobuf/cmake/Release/libprotobuf-lite

    external/re2/Release/re2

    external/abseil-cpp/absl/base/Release/absl_base

    external/abseil-cpp/absl/base/Release/absl_throw_delegate

    external/abseil-cpp/absl/container/Release/absl_raw_hash_set

    external/abseil-cpp/absl/hash/Release/absl_hash

    external/abseil-cpp/absl/hash/Release/absl_city

    external/abseil-cpp/absl/hash/Release/absl_low_level_hash

)


Finally, include the .h file in your main.cpp:
#include "core/session/onnxruntime_cxx_api.h"
